Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Encoders

Interface EncoderIO

All Known Implementing Classes:
CanCoderWrapper, ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder
public interface EncoderIO
Interface representing the interface to encoder hardware, providing methods for configuring, reading, and managing encoder values and faults.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static class 
    EncoderIO.EncoderIOInputs
    Represents the inputs for the gyro sensor used in the encoder system.

  • Method Details

    • updateInputs

      default void updateInputs(EncoderIO.EncoderIOInputs inputs)
      Updates the encoder inputs based on external sources. This method is typically called to fetch the latest encoder data.
      Parameters:
      inputs - The encoder inputs to update.

    • periodic

      default void periodic(CanCoderWrapper encoder)
      Periodic method that is called to process updates for a CanCoderWrapper. This is an additional method for custom periodic updates based on the encoder type.
      Parameters:
      encoder - The CanCoderWrapper instance to process.

    • periodic

      default void periodic(ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder encoder)
      Periodic method that is called to process updates for a ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder. This method provides periodic updates for this encoder type.
      Parameters:
      encoder - The ThriftyAbsoluteEncoder instance to process.

    • periodic

      default void periodic()
      Periodic method that performs any required updates for the encoder. Typically called at regular intervals during the robot's operation.

    • configAbsEncoder

      default void configAbsEncoder()
      Configures the absolute encoder sensor position, including determining the inversion state. This method ensures that the encoder's setup is correctly applied, including handling inversion.

    • getAbsolutePosition

      default double getAbsolutePosition()
      Gets the absolute position of the encoder. The absolute position is typically represented in a normalized rotation range.
      Returns:
      The absolute position of the encoder, typically in a rotation range of (-1 to 0) or (0 to 1).

    • factoryDefault

      default void factoryDefault()
      Resets the encoder to its factory defaults. This will reset all encoder settings but will not clear the stored zero offset.

    • clearStickyFaults

      default void clearStickyFaults()
      Clears any sticky faults on the encoder. Sticky faults may occur due to hardware issues and should be cleared as part of the normal maintenance.

    • checkForFaults

      default void checkForFaults()
      Checks for any faults in the encoder system. This method should be called periodically to ensure the encoder is functioning properly.
